pathways.name: Cell Cycle Regulation
pathways.function: Prevents uncontrolled cell division by pausing the cell cycle for DNA repair

pathways.name: Apoptosis
pathways.function: Induces programmed cell death in response to DNA damage

pathways.name: DNA Repair
pathways.function: Activates repair proteins when DNA is damaged

pathways.name: Tumor Suppression
pathways.function: Prevents the formation of tumors by regulating cell cycle and death

KRAS.full_name: Kirsten Rat Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog

pathways.name: RAS-MAPK Signaling
pathways.function: Transmits growth signals from the cell membrane to the nucleus

pathways.name: Apoptosis Regulation
pathways.function: Can block or activate apoptosis depending on context

pathways.name: Cytoskeletal Organization
pathways.function: Involved in reshaping cell structure during migration or division

pathways.name: EGFR Signaling Pathway
pathways.function: Promotes cell proliferation, differentiation, and survival

pathways.name: Proliferation
pathways.function: Triggers pathways that lead to DNA replication and mitosis

pathways.name: Apoptosis
pathways.function: Has dual roles; can promote or inhibit apoptosis

pathways.name: Cell Migration
pathways.function: Facilitates epithelial to mesenchymal transitions and mobility

pathways.name: DNA Repair
pathways.function: Essential for homologous recombination repair of DNA double-strand breaks

pathways.name: Cell Cycle Checkpoint
pathways.function: Halts the cell cycle to allow for repair of damaged DNA

pathways.name: Homologous Recombination
pathways.function: Facilitates high-fidelity DNA repair using a sister chromatid
